thread.title: WATCH: Frustrated Wolves fans and Tim Spiers on loss
thread.title_full: WATCH: Frustrated Wolves fans and Tim Spiers on loss

title: WATCH: Frustrated Wolves fans and Tim Spiers on loss
text:
Log in and start commenting 
Some shoddy defending from Wolves contributed heavily to the defeat, with Martinez at fault for Martin's second when he failed to claim a Bradley Johnson cross. 
Johnson himself scored Derby's third with Wolves unable to clear a corner, although the scoreline was made respectable by Adam Le Fondre's second half goal to bring it back to 4-2, after Johnny Russell had increased Derby's lead after the break. Receive daily email updates from the Express & Star
